problem_summary_simple: Count ways to split ranges into two groups such that overlapping ranges are in the same group.
problem_summary_technical: Sort ranges by start time, merge overlapping intervals to find connected components. Each component can be in either group.
key_insights: The core constraint is that overlapping ranges must be in the same group, implying a transitive relationship.
Sorting the ranges by their start times allows for efficient merging of overlapping intervals.
Each merged interval (or connected component of ranges) can independently be assigned to either of the two groups, leading to 2^k possibilities where k is the number of merged intervals.
